solution.text:
Consider the given equation : \(_{k}_y = _{j}_x \)
Now, in order to plot the graph, consider two different values of x, plug them into the equation and find the corresponding values of y.
For instance:
When \(x = 0\) , \(y = 0\)
Similarly, when \(x = _{k}_\) , \(y = _{j}_\)
(Note, you can use any values for x to find the corresponding y value)

Once you have found two solutions, plot the points on a graph and join them together with a straight line. Compare it with the options given below. It is then clear that the correct option is:
